com.camerontec.util.jmx

Interface IExtendedMBeanServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MBeanServer, MBeanServerConnection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExtendedMBeanServer

    public interface IExtendedMBeanServer
extends MBeanServer
    This interface complements interface MBeanServer with the following extra methods:
    • registerMBeanSafe(java.lang.Object, javax.management.ObjectName), which behaves as MBeanServer.registerMBean(java.lang.Object, javax.management.ObjectName) but does not throw any exception when an error occurs. Instead, reports any failure as an IllegalStateException.
    • unregisterMBeanSafe(javax.management.ObjectName), which behaves as MBeanServer.unregisterMBean(javax.management.ObjectName) but does not throw any exception when an error occurs. Instead, reports any failure as an IllegalStateException.
    • unregisterMBeansSafe(java.util.Set<javax.management.ObjectName>), which can be used to unregister several MBeans at the same time.
    • getObjectInstanceSafe(javax.management.ObjectName), which behaves as MBeanServer.getObjectInstance(javax.management.ObjectName) but does not throw any exception when an error occurs. Instead, reports any failure as an IllegalStateException.
    • getAttributeSafe(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String), which behaves as MBeanServer.getAttribute(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String) but does not throw any exception when an error occurs. Instead, reports any failure as an IllegalStateException.
    • getAttributesSafe(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String[]), which behaves as MBeanServer.getAttributes(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String[]) but does not throw any exception when an error occurs. Instead, reports any failure as an IllegalStateException.
    • getDescendants(javax.management.ObjectName), which computes the list of descendants of a given MBean as per the hierarchical naming scheme used in management application.
    • getMBeanServerName(), which returns a name identifying the MBean Server.
    • release(), which instructs the MBeanServerFactory to release this MBeanServer.

    • Method Detail

      • addNotificationListenerSafe

        void addNotificationListenerSafe(ObjectName objectName,
                                 NotificationListener notificationListener,
                                 NotificationFilter notificationFilter,
                                 Object handback)
                          throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for adding a notification listener to an MBean without having to catch any JMX-related exception. Such exceptions are reported as {IllegalStateException}s.
        Parameters:
        objectName - The name of the MBean on which the listener should be added
        notificationListener - The listener object which will handle the notifications emitted by the registered MBean
        notificationFilter - The filter object. If filter is null, no filtering will be performed before handling notifications
        handback - The context to be sent to the listener when a notification is emitted
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to add the notification listener
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.addNotificationListener(javax.management.ObjectName, javax.management.NotificationListener, javax.management.NotificationFilter, java.lang.Object)

      • removeNotificationListenerSafe

        void removeNotificationListenerSafe(ObjectName objectName,
                                    NotificationListener notificationListener)
                             throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for removing a notification listener from an MBean without having to catch any JMX-related exception. Such exceptions are reported as IllegalStateExceptions.
        Parameters:
        objectName - The name of the MBean from which the listener should be removed
        notificationListener - The listener to be removed
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to remove the notification listener
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.removeNotificationListener(javax.management.ObjectName, javax.management.NotificationListener)

      • getDescendants

        HashSet<ObjectName> getDescendants(ObjectName objectName)
        Given an object name, retrieves the set of object names representing all descendants of this MBean currently registered in the MBean server, as per the MA's hierarchical naming scheme.
        Parameters:
        objectName - the ObjectName of an MBean
        Returns:
        a HashSet, containing all the descendants of the MBean registered under name objectName as per the MA's hierarchical naming scheme. This set will be empty in the case where no MBean is currently registered under name objectName or if this Mbean has got no descendant.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objectName is null

      • getAttributeSafe

        Object getAttributeSafe(ObjectName objectName,
                        String attributeName)
                 throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for retrieving an MBean's attribute value without having to catch any JMX-related exception.
        Parameters:
        objectName - the ObjectName of an MBean
        attributeName - the name of an attribute
        Returns:
        the corresponding attribute value
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to retrieve the attribute value
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.getAttribute(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String)

      • getAttributesSafe

        AttributeList getAttributesSafe(ObjectName objectName,
                                String[] attributeNames)
                         throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for retrieving an MBean's attributes values without having to catch any JMX-related exception.
        Parameters:
        objectName - the ObjectName of an MBean
        attributeNames - the names of the attributes to retrieve
        Returns:
        the corresponding attribute values
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to retrieve the attribute values
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.getAttributes(javax.management.ObjectName, java.lang.String[])

        the corresponding ObjectInstance

      • registerMBeanSafe

        ObjectInstance registerMBeanSafe(Object mbean,
                                 ObjectName objectName)
                          throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for registering an MBean without having to catch any JMX-related exception.
        Parameters:
        mbean - the MBean to register
        objectName - the ObjectName under which the MBean should be registered
        Returns:
        An ObjectInstance, containing the ObjectName and the Java class name of the newly registered MBean
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to register the MBean
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.registerMBean(Object, ObjectName)

      • unregisterMBeanSafe

        void unregisterMBeanSafe(ObjectName objectName)
                  throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for unregistering an MBean without having to catch any JMX-related exception.
        Parameters:
        objectName - the ObjectName of the MBean to unregister
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to unregister the MBean
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.unregisterMBean(ObjectName)

      • unregisterMBeansSafe

        void unregisterMBeansSafe(Set<ObjectName> objectNames)
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Utility routine for unregistering several MBeans at the same time.
        Parameters:
        objectNames - the ObjectNames of the MBeans to unregister
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an error occurs while attempting to unregister one of the MBean
        See Also:
        MBeanServer.unregisterMBean(ObjectName)

        Returns:
        this MBean's metadata
        Throws:

        See Also:

      • release

        void release()
        Instructs the MBeanServerFactory to release this MBeanServer. Invoking this method more than once has no effect.
